page.title: 07LIFE ON A DAIRY FARM
page.content: East View is owned by Mr.Thomas Graham Gibson.The farm has an area of three hundred and twenty seven acres.One hundred and seventeen acres of that is fell land.There is one hundred and thirty acres of silage land and the rest is good grazing land.Mr.Gibson has one hundred and twenty cows and three bulls.At 6.00am Mr.Ian Gibson takes the cows into the milking parlour.The parlour holds 16 cows 8 down each side. It is called the herring bone parlour.Milking is at 6.00am and 4.00pm each day and lasts two hours. After milking Mr.Gibson washes out the collecting jugs,first with 40 gallons of cold water then with 40 gallons of hot water and chemicals then with 40 gallons of cold water.75% of the cows are British Friesians and 25% of them are Holsteins.There are 2 collie dogs.
